author: F.H. Buckley
title: Trump and Canada May Chill a Nafta Deal
text:
If there were ever a no-brainer in international trade, it would be free trade between the U.S. and Canada. The two countries are the closest of friends and allies, and their economies are so tightly linked that trade barriers with Canada could put eight million Americans out of work. And if youâ€™re the sort who worries about trade deficits, the U.S. runs a $12.5 billion surplus with Canada in goods and services. Despite these benefits, however, the current renegotiation of the North American Free Trade Agreement may result in a breakup between the two trading partners.
